column4: Hi All. I just installed UBUNTU server, and I want to set up a simple window manager, I installed fluxbox but I can get it to be the default WM, any know how?
Install a simple login manager like xdm then you can choose what session from that
where would I see those menu options in XDM?
make a file, ~/.startx                 in the file, put the command to load your wm
The ~/.startx  and ~/.xinitrc files tell X what wm to use
.xinitrc also doesnt exist, I currently have icewm installed and that is what keeps coming up after logging in via XDM
instead of putting: fluxbox &&       in startx you could put in xinitrc: exec startfluxbox
If they are not existing now you make them :)
I will make them, but I'm trying to understand how linux knows to use icewem now, since these files dont exist, it must be specified somewhere else..?
It is the default one that xdm will use as fallback in it's own config if it doesn't find one of those 2 files in your ~
so cant I just change XDM's default?
You can also do: sudo update-alternatives --config x-window-manager
That will change the xdm one
Changing xdm default wm is sytemwide
I want a system wide change, the problem now is that I cant even boot because I get that ubuntu BUG: soft lockup  error and the system wont sytart
after I added the exec startfluxbox to ~/.xinitrc it still doesnt start into fluxbox..
Perhaps just exec fluxbox instread of exec startfluxbox
About the soft lockup error i have no idea
The hylafax server taking PS input?
